meanings.sent1: That gink always makes silly decisions.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to that gink; they don't know what they're talking about.
meanings.sent3: The gink thought wearing socks on their hands was a good idea.
meanings.sent4: He's a real gink, always getting into trouble.
meanings.sent5: The village remembered the gink who tried to ride a cow like a horse.

meanings.sent1: Be careful not to gink others in your business dealings.
meanings.sent2: He tried to gink his way out of paying for the meal.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky salesman attempted to gink the customer with false promises.
meanings.sent4: She felt cheated when he tried to gink her out of her savings.
meanings.sent5: The con artist was known for his ability to gink unsuspecting victims.

meanings.sent1: The new kitchen gink made cooking so much easier.
meanings.sent2: I always carry my favorite tech gink with me.
meanings.sent3: The little gink helped him fix his broken toy.
meanings.sent4: She was fascinated by the shiny gink on the table.
meanings.sent5: The scientist invented a revolutionary gink to clean the air.
